website_summaries.verdict: The ViewSonic VP2770-LED is a well-appointed 27-inch monitor for professionals who require accurate colors. It's a solid performer, but it has trouble at the dark end of the grayscale, and it's expensive.

customer_reviews.title: LOVE IT. This is a very nice monitor
customer_reviews.text: LOVE IT. This is a very nice monitor. I use it for at least 9 hours a day. Great quality, color, and clarity. The stand was huge, so I ordered a cheap articulating wall mount off Amazon. I think it was a VideoSecu bracket. This eliminated the bulky stand, and I can now move it around with ease above my desk. I sit this monitor next to my 2013 Macbook Air, and use it as a second monitor. Would definitely buy this again, but hopefully I won't have to.
customer_reviews.author: Rick

customer_reviews.title: Best screen of many that I ordered
customer_reviews.text: Best screen of many that I ordered. No dead pixels, etc. But the IPS glow in the corners can be annoying when switching from different panel tech. Additionally, the screen is so bright to me (even at 0 brightness) that I have to use Windows Magnifier to invert colors in order to read text without going blind. I think, in hindsight, I probably should have gotten a monitor that offered paper viewing, but this'll do for a bit. I'm used to its flaws at this point and it's a gorgeous screen overall. :)
customer_reviews.author: Intamin

customer_reviews.title: Really very impressed
customer_reviews.text: I'm picky on electronics, shopped for a long time before pulling the trigger on this monitor. Very happy; dont need to go bigger. Not a single dead pixel, which was my biggest worry. Flat, non-reflective screen (ideal for me). I have a much older ViewSonic which is still working like a champ. Note that for older eyes, the native pixel resolution might be too small, so you might not need as many pixels (1900x1080 or 1200 might be okay). This monitor does a better than expected job at other lower resolutions as well. I'm driving with Intel integrated graphics controller. Adjustable, rotatable, variety of input options. Recommended. Able to view two documents side-by-side and legibly.
customer_reviews.author: Jim P.

customer_reviews.title: Finest yet of several Viewsonics I've owned
customer_reviews.text: In service 90+ days without a glitch. Finest yet of several Viewsonics I've owned. First "wide screen" I've used. Takes the place of two 19" 4:3 very comfortably. Absolutely no defects noticed. Quick, easy setup. Cannot see any light bleed along edges. Be sure to use displayport for primary. It did not play nice with an Intel NUC I was building. Had the NUC connected to the HDMI while my PC was connected through displayport. Very hard to get the NUC splash/bios to come up in this config. NUC worked fine when only it was connected to displayport. Could have been something I did wrong.
customer_reviews.author: William E. Harris

customer_reviews.title: Great To Look At Monitor
customer_reviews.text: This monitor looks fantastic. I can't believe it actually looks better than my previous NEC MultiSync PA271W which I paid a lot more for.I have it right next to my old NEC and can't stop looking back at its clarity and vibrance. I'm already thinking of getting another so I can have the two side by side. Text is very sharp and clear to read. Colors are clean. Photos look amazing. With Cinema 4D R15 it looks great. 3D Renders are beautiful. The high resolution makes the text small but it's so clear I have no problem reading anything on the display.
customer_reviews.author: R. Marquez

customer_reviews.title: Excellent monitor - best I've used.
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic display. Displayport, 2560x1440 really adds much needed display resolution. Took me a little bit to adjust (now my secondary monitor - a Samsung 22" which was ordinarily very good) to having two screens with the main screen so much nicer and the secondary screen being such a poor monitor by comparison. Can't speak to color representation, etc. and I didn't really care about that. I just wanted a high quality monitor that had a higher pixel count and display port. Very nice for everything I use it for. Thanks ViewSonic!
customer_reviews.author: Herr_Blucher

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Product
customer_reviews.text: I need a new monitor to replace my Viewsonic P220f 22" CRT because it wasn't HDCP compliant, since it didn't have a digital interface. This was an excellent replacement becasue the colors are sharp, the image is clear, I can finally watch movies on Blu-ray disc again, and this product has connection for nearly every type of video interface. The only other thing I would like is for it to be a 4k display because Viewsonic is one of the very few companies that auto calibrates the colors.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful monitor - excellent crisp picture
customer_reviews.text: Have had the monitor a couple of weeks. Easy to assemble. Worked right of the box. No dead pixels. Excellent crisp picture in the highest resolution. Didn't adjust the colours, but turned down the brightness a bit (think to around 50). The foot is a bit big on my desk, but most the back (which isn't a problem). Nice to be able to have, for example, a Word document and an Excel sheet, open at the same time and being able to read everything comfortably. Wouldn't hesitate to recommend this monitor to anyone image editing.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: "SuperClear" is truth in advertising
customer_reviews.text: Buying a monitor can be bit of a crapshoot. What I like: The screen is very clear and the colors are amazing. The 27" size is not too big but it does take on "wide" proportions (which I like). It's thin and light weight and I appreciate also the branding is subtle (not bold and obvious). This monitor is VESA compatible, which is nice (eventually I'll hang it on a wall). Time will tell how it holds up but so far I'm really pleased and think the price point represents a good value. I would recommend this monitor to others.
customer_reviews.author: gazoller

customer_reviews.title: Liked it so much, I bought two.
customer_reviews.text: I am finicky and always hesitant when I make a purchase such as this. The screen resolution, color quality, luminance, construction are all pretty solid. I do not have buyer's remorse...so much, my appreciation has been stated by this review's title.
customer_reviews.author: tcarrier

customer_reviews.title: Worked so good, I bought two!
customer_reviews.text: Recently purchased two of these beautiful monitors. I read a lot of reviews on Amazon and wanted to get a monitor that would have excellent build quality as well as a great picture. I was impressed by this monitor. Yes, it was more that some comparable brands, but had zero dead pixels and and excellent picture and was already color balanced! Do yourself a favor and reduce the brightness from 100% to 50% when you get it. Other than that, it's awesome.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Awesome monitors! ViewSonic quality
customer_reviews.text: Awesome monitors! ViewSonic quality, attention to detail, above average green/environmental and attention to ergonomic factors come through on these monitors and ViewSonic is absolutely stellar in that regard. Terrific 4k monitors with fabulous depth and image rendering that will blow your mind. The 2780s are out and if you have to have the latest and greatest go for it - and the extra $. You wont feel like you are missing anything if you get these monitors. Use for software design, gaming, and architectural layouts.
customer_reviews.author: Blagard

customer_reviews.title: Great Monitor for the Price
customer_reviews.text: Pros: - Gloriously large - Terrific image - Plain, black design (which I like) - Great price for the features - USB 3 ports Cons: - Have to lower the sharpness setting to 0 or 25 in order to make text less jaggy - My new Windows 8 machine seems to have problems with the USB hub built into the monitor Comments: Am repeatedly getting blue screens of death, with "driver-power-state-failure" error on waking from sleep. Then monitor USB hub isn't recognized until unplugging it and reconnecting. Still troubleshooting this one . . . . Aside from the USB hub issue, which I haven't seen others comment on, this monitor can't be beat for the price.
customer_reviews.author: C5IL

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful Qaulity
customer_reviews.text: This is a great monitor, except for a couple of things. Good: excellent color reproduction; superb overall quality; great resolution; fantastic size. Bad: not user friendly control panel, as only has buttons 1 and 2 up and down, which makes it challenging to navigate and make a selection. Overall, a great purchase, even with this control panel, I would suggest it to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Olena_p

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding Monitor
customer_reviews.text: The Viewsonic VP2270 has the best image I have experienced on any monitor. I use a Dell 3011 (30 inch 2560 X 1600 resolution IPS) monitor at work and find the color rendition and bright LED backlighting of this Viewsonic to be superior. There are no dead or bright pixels and no back-light bleeding as others have noticed on other high resolution monitors.This monitor also has a USB 3.0 hub that can also be used as a USB 2.0 hub with four downstream connectors. Monitor has met my full expectations, and more.
customer_reviews.author: W. Hermina

customer_reviews.title: Meets my expectation perfectly
customer_reviews.text: I was encouraged by the may positive (even glowing) reviews of this monitor including specific properties that were important to me. They were right! Excellent resolution, easy adjustments, right size, all of the needed cables, low power consumption; in short, I would recommend this to anyone who can afford it. This unit costs less than the Apple monitor (23") that I used happily for about 5 years only to have it die. And, this is at least as flexible. I am one happy customer.
customer_reviews.author: Valpodoc

customer_reviews.title: Wow now i know wha I've been missing.
customer_reviews.text: I am used to using a 27" 1980x1080 display. now that used this WQHD monitor I will never go back. I do photograhy as a hobby and this monitor is excellent. What a difference it makes in the workflow layout and details. Color calibration seems spot on. A Spyder calibration made not noticeable difference. I appear to have only 1 visibly bad pixel and its not noticeable at all. Would definately recommend.
customer_reviews.author: D. Chesser

customer_reviews.title: Needs to be blacker
customer_reviews.text: The blacks aren't the darkest blacks I was expecting. For a pro monitor, I would have expected them to be darker. But other than that, the resolution and color are fantastic.
customer_reviews.author: Joel and Amber

customer_reviews.title: A best LCD monitor I have ever owned
customer_reviews.text: It is an outstanding display. The display color quality is supper clear. It is a truly professional monitor. I can change color mood instantly within a few clicks. I had six monitors (3 ViewSonic and 3 Asus) and this monitor is the best one. I used them mostly for stock chart graphic display and some for web surfing. I choose this LCD for both.
customer_reviews.author: Tien Nguyen

customer_reviews.title: Excellent computer monitor!
customer_reviews.text: I've owned several ViewSonic monitors and this is by far the best computer monitor that I've ever owned. The colors are vibrant and crisp and the native screen resolution is 2560 x 1440. It's amazing that a nature desktop picture displays a lot more scenery at 2560 x 1440 than at 1920 x 1080. The scene is not simply expanded but it displays additional imagery that you cannot see at lower screen resolutions.
customer_reviews.author: A. Momon

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: Product arrived yesterday with no dead pixels or backlight issues. The screen is amazing! Didn't notice any input lag whatsoever, and I play a lot of shooters! Only problem is, I might have to buy another GPU if I want to play heavy graphics PC games MAXed at 1440p. For instance, even with a GTX TITAN I couldn't get 60 FPS on Tomb Raider with TressFX, ultra shadows and AA on 1440p (averaged about 46). But I truly recommend this display to any gamer! There's really a big difference when you jump from 1080p to 1440p! Can't beat this product at this price!
customer_reviews.author: Roberto Miranda Colares Júnior

customer_reviews.title: Big, bright, no glare 2K monitor
customer_reviews.text: Probably the best monitor I've ever purchased. Clear, bright, no glare, flicker free and doesn't put off too much heat or RF noise. Only wish it had a native HDMI input. Would certainly buy one again if needed.
customer_reviews.author: Micah Stroud

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for CAD
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I was looking for in a CAD monitor. I have two 27" 2560x1440 monitors - the ViewSonic and the Dell - side by side. The ViewSonic LED is clear and crisp with colors that pop and where the subtle differences in colors show up in CAD line work. The Dell is off white and the colors all tend to merge in together. Very happy.
customer_reviews.author: Motw

customer_reviews.title: Yes, the resolution is greater than a 1080p monitor!
customer_reviews.text: Just like any monitor that you purchase, you will need to have a high-quality graphics card in order to get the optimum performance out of this monitor. For those of you who don't know what a graphics card is, it is the board that attaches to your mother board, and where you plug your monitor into the back of the computer. This monitor was a bit pricey, but when I began using it, I felt that it was money well-spent! I highly recommend this monitor to anyone who is seriously into Photoshop, video, movies, and gaming!
customer_reviews.author: Tree

customer_reviews.title: makes an awesome alternative to the Apple Thunderbolt Display
customer_reviews.text: Worked perfectly, no dead pixels, makes an awesome alternative to the Apple Thunderbolt Display, which is as of this writing, overpriced and dated.
customer_reviews.author: Hans

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful image and reliable electronics
customer_reviews.text: I was impressed enough with my first IPS Viewsonic, that I purchased a second one. The image is terrific, and there was not a single pixel either stuck on or off - same with the second monitor. Both are on daily, and I have not had any infantile electronic failures.
customer_reviews.author: Epignathus

customer_reviews.title: Great monitor
customer_reviews.text: I just upgraded from an older LG Flatron L222wt which I thought was pretty good. Now, I have this new viewsonic sitting right next to the older LG in a dual monitor setup and the color and clarity is not even close. I do a lot of digital art, so color accuracy is very important. The size is perfect too. It gives me plenty of room to lay out my photoshop palettes and any reference pictures I might need. I researched a lot of other monitors before finally settling on this one and I'm very happy with its performance.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Great balance of price and performance
customer_reviews.text: Great balance of price and performance. I purchased two with a dual monitor stand and they have worked flawlessly for over a year. I'm not doing crazy gaming on them or anything. They work great for normal office use.
customer_reviews.author: Gin Sim

customer_reviews.title: Awesome monitor!
customer_reviews.text: Incredible monitor! Exactly what I was looking for. I actually returned a Samsung UHD monitor in favor for this one. I love ViewSonic products and this monitor definitely does not disappoint! I will be buying more of these :)
customer_reviews.author: andrew hughes

customer_reviews.title: Don't compromise, get this display
customer_reviews.text: After several weeks of reading reviews and looking over other 27" models at local stores, I finally settled on this. You can spend a few hundred less on a cheap Korean eBay import, and I know what you'll get: wobbly plastic, poor out-of-the-box calibration, limited or no angle adjustment, and nearly useless on-screen settings. Others have enumerated the strengths of this model, I'm just here to tell you they're worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Collin Flynn

customer_reviews.title: Superb Monitor for Graphics Display
customer_reviews.text: This is my first IPS monitor and my first ViewSonic and I absolutely love it. I have always used Samsung in the past. I do a lot of work in Adobe Photoshop and cannot believe how rich and true the colors are, especially the white, with this monitor.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara Wilber

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: Lots of nice functionality/connectivity. Easy to use screen menu. No glare. Easy on the eyes given you are driving at its native resolution. ps Had to reduce the brightness to 50%
customer_reviews.author: Pee Gee 808

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Excellent screen easy to adjust. Best monitor I've had in a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Calvin Stoudt Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Great and reliable
customer_reviews.text: Have had this for well over a year and it is the envy of everyone that sees it. Great for art, video, etc. With the 4k monitors coming out, this will be a thing of the past, though.
customer_reviews.author: John B. Baker

customer_reviews.title: Nice!
customer_reviews.text: Every gamer's dream monitor! No dead pixels and the screen is almost too bright at 50% brightness setting. The additional screen real estate at 2560 x 1440 really helps for video editing too. Best monitor I've ever owned.
customer_reviews.author: S. Banas

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful, perfect screen. Running Windows 8.1, 64 bit, i7 cpu 3.6ghz, with GeForce GTX 750 graphics card at 2560x1440.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff in Colorado

customer_reviews.title: Great monitor and service.
customer_reviews.text: I bought the VP2770 based upon all of the great reviews. First the packing is great and it was delivered in two days from TheNerds Store. Came with all of the cables one could need to connect to any video card. I'm using the Display Port. The Picture quality is Amazing! The only Con that I have is the base has very large feet and takes up desk space. But it also means that the monitor is very steady.
customer_reviews.author: E. G.

customer_reviews.title: Jose Gonzalez
customer_reviews.text: This Monitor has very good performance, has incredible sharpness and clean, I like its design and functionality, I give five stars it deserves it, I replaced my old monitor VX2753MH-Led, with this new model Viewsonic VP-2770 Led.
customer_reviews.author: gonz33

customer_reviews.title: Good Choice
customer_reviews.text: The only doubt i had was about the refresh rate of the monitor and the possibility of any blur, i have a few months with the monitor now and all i can say is i haven’t found any noticeable problem while gaming so i would amply recommend the product to anyone looking for a gaming monitor, plus the resolution is great and a single gtx 680 has no problem running almost any game on full res and max graphic settings.
customer_reviews.author: Alfredo Nazar Tinoco

customer_reviews.title: This one by far is the best I've had so far
customer_reviews.text: I've been using Veiwsonic monitors for many years. This one by far is the best I've had so far. Don't let the price scare you off, it is worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: Apache-=CW=-

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Saved hundreds of dollars on the monitor as opposed to Apple's monitor.
customer_reviews.author: ABBA's Fernando

customer_reviews.title: I like the monitor
customer_reviews.text: I like the monitor, but absolutely hate the touch controls on the bezel. They are way too sensitive and almost impossible to see.
customer_reviews.author: SMS

customer_reviews.title: Great Monitor! Look no where else!
customer_reviews.text: Great monitors for the price. Screen estate is amazing and the best monitor I ever purchased! For gaming it is phenomenon! Playing Metro Last Light and I must say the big screen give its an extra kick! If your in the market for a 1440p monitors, I highly recommend you to check this one out! I7 3930k OC 4.5ghz GTX 780 SLI 16 GB RAM Get this monitor and never look back!! =D
customer_reviews.author: DD

customer_reviews.title: The First LCD Display to Meet Photographer's Needs
customer_reviews.text: I am a professional photographer and I want my display to show photos, not cartoon versions of photos. I find most LCD displays cartoonish. It amazes me that people gave up the subtlety of CRT displays for the fashion statement of LCDs. But I have to say, this one delivers. It captures the full dynamic range I enjoyed with good CRT displays. But with much larger resolution, size and brightness. It is not cheap, but in my case it was worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Robert D. Bernstein

customer_reviews.title: FAR too much light bleed
customer_reviews.text: All IPS panels have a certain amount of light bleed around the edges, but the VP2770-LED has by far the most light bleed of any of the three IPS monitors that I own, including a basic $150 model. The bottom right corner has noticeable bright spot (see photos). I regret not returning this monitor when I had the chance. I ended up giving it 2 stars because once color levels are adjusted, color representation is accurate. But the light bleed makes this unsuitable for professional use or for photo editing.
customer_reviews.author: P. Baker

customer_reviews.title: This is a perfect addition to my photography processing setup
customer_reviews.text: This is a perfect addition to my photography processing setup. I often print photos at 12" x 16" and this monitor allows me to see my them at better than 1:1 size. The resolution and picture quality are superb.
customer_reviews.author: Charles A. Floyd

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful screen, well worth the purchase
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful screen, well worth the purchase. The base could have been a bit sturdier and easier to assemble but everything else in this unit is absolutely perfected. Happy with my purchase so far, however as others have noted here base brightness is a little too bright (sweet spot is 15%-20%)
customer_reviews.author: Mehidi Malik

customer_reviews.title: I love it, The best screen i had
customer_reviews.text: i really love this screen, best colors. large scale so i can see everything. I'm a photographer and PC enthusiast, i do heavy work on the PC. and I have also test it with some of the Games. and believe me you will not notice the difference.
customer_reviews.author: Hamad

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Love this monitor, Its huge and has beautiful color right out of the box. It replaced my old 22 veiwsonic which I was never unhappy with either.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Carpenter

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Monitor
customer_reviews.text: Amazing quality. Comes with a color calibration report from the factory. ViewSonic Includes plenty of cables with this monitor (an HDMI, Displayport, DVI, and VGA). The stand is sturdy and well-adjustable. This monitor has less input lag than its direct competitors.
customer_reviews.author: AH

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful, well designed monitor!
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy, perfect color, nice design. The only thing that I can complain about is the location of the USB ports, which is really more of a problem related to where I have the monitor, and not really a flaw of the monitor itself. I use it primarily for image editing.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Cefalu

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Shipped with noticeable dead pixels in the middle of the display.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Product was great for the 10 days it worked.
customer_reviews.text: I have had this product 10 days. I restarted my computer this morning and the ViewSonic screen came up pink and none of the USB ports work. It appears that there is absolutely no telephone support and that they will get back to me within 48 hours. I thought this product would last more than 10 days.
customer_reviews.author: Robin

customer_reviews.title: ViewSonic VP2770-LED 27-Inch IPS LED Monitor - great monitor
customer_reviews.text: This is a really nice monitor with a crystal clear display. If you can afford the price, you'll be quite pleased with this monitor.
customer_reviews.author: Remigius J. Onyshczak

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant!
customer_reviews.text: Paired with a MacMini, this monitor really performs. The adjustable base and ability to turn 90 degrees makes page layouts a breeze.
customer_reviews.author: John Clark

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great monitor and value. Can't be beat for the price. Not a single dead pixel in mine.
customer_reviews.author: Spencer W. White

customer_reviews.title: WOW!
customer_reviews.text: Had this monitor for 3 hours. Fantastic. Moved up from a Samsung 24 inch 1920x1200 resolution which I've had for 4 years. If you can find this Viewsonic for under $800, buy it.
customer_reviews.author: Shel10

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Monitor!!!
customer_reviews.text: Would recommend this monitor to anyone who is serious about computer graphics. The best monitor I have ever used - period!
customer_reviews.author: Bryan Tamietti

customer_reviews.title: I have calibrated this screen countless times, but yet ...
customer_reviews.text: I have calibrated this screen countless times, but yet can not get my prints from several different professional labs to match the screen. The reds seem to be off. I've tried adjusting the RGB sliders to compensate, but am unable to match. All my prints from various labs come back comparable to each other, but none match the screen, so I've concluded that it is something with the monitor that is off. Disappointing as I am a photographer and need my calibrated screen to match my photo prints.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole Mills

customer_reviews.title: Great monitor, but seems to have an issue if screen gets hit accidentally
customer_reviews.text: Love the screen and the built quality of this monitor. However, I slightly hit the screen with the corner of my laptop and now have a hairline on the screen. Not something big but concerning that the screen got a hairline from such a accidental hit.
customer_reviews.author: Nitai

customer_reviews.title: Periodic (often) Black outs
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a second larger monitor for my Wacom Companion PC Tablet. I know ViewSonic makes great products but this monitor kept blacking out on me, for about 5 seconds, every 15 minutes. It got to be too annoying and I didn't have the time to call tech support to see if it was my system or it's simply not compatible with a Wacom PC tablet.
customer_reviews.author: 2muchStuff

customer_reviews.title: Probably fine for gaming and as a general purpose monitor, but not for professional work
customer_reviews.text: An okay monitor, but if you do serious image work, it likely won't do. Tried 2 of these, and both had severe edge bleeding to the point I could not use it for image work. I instead sprung for an NEC MultiSync with SpectraView - and what a difference. I guess you get what you pay for. This is probably fine for gaming and as a general purpose monitor, but I tried it for professional work and it just didn't cut it.
customer_reviews.author: abra2345

customer_reviews.title: Scan-rate Issue Forced Return - Potential buyers should note the size of the stand. (14 inches!)
customer_reviews.text: Just returned mine. Best I can tell it had a scan-rate issue, as I couldn't use it for more than a few minutes without incredible eye-strain. At first use the image quality seemed good, loved the additional screen real estate, etc..., but my eyes couldn't take it. Setting that quality issue aside, potential buyers should be aware that the stand on this monitor is enormous! People with a shallow desk will want to either wall-mount this monitor or mount it on an arm that attaches to the back of the desk. My desk is only 20 inches deep, and with a monitor stand depth of almost 14 inches there was barely room for the keyboard and mouse.
customer_reviews.author: B. Harriger

customer_reviews.title: although I had to adjust it for graphic design and photos it was easy.
customer_reviews.text: This is a sharp monitor, although I had to adjust it for graphic design and photos it was easy.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew N.

customer_reviews.title: Great monitor
customer_reviews.text: I do a lot of graphics work and this monitor has great resolution. I know there are better monitors, but this one works for me.
customer_reviews.author: Al Pop

customer_reviews.title: This IPS display is wonderful and the screen size is just right for the ...
customer_reviews.text: The monitor is all that I had hoped. This IPS display is wonderful and the screen size is just right for the photography work that I do.
customer_reviews.author: RBFeindr

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for!
customer_reviews.text: Amazing clarity and performance with this monitor. More expensive? Yes Worth it? YES
customer_reviews.author: Tim Butler

customer_reviews.title: I like the large screen and the very sharp image
customer_reviews.text: The monitor arrived promptly, connected without difficulty, and has been working perfectly. I like the large screen and the very sharp image.
customer_reviews.author: Ray Freeman

customer_reviews.title: 3 dead pixels. :(
customer_reviews.text: great out of box color, but I found three dead pixels near the center of the screen. very annoying. returned it to amazon right away.
customer_reviews.author: Pallymore

customer_reviews.title: Does not furnction well at all.
customer_reviews.text: This is the worst monitor i have ever used. It is ok when its functioning, but the DVI port has a critical error, at least once a month when i turn on the computer it stops working and you have to physically unplug it and then re-plug it back in. We have changed cables twice and it still happens, the port is actually partially corrupt. I've been using computer for 20 years and never had a bad monitor port, this one is terrible. Also, the touch buttons are horrible, incredibly hard to read the text and hard to push correctly. Terrible Product.
customer_reviews.author: Dan B. Table

customer_reviews.title: I love it
customer_reviews.text: I now can have outlook, IE and a couple of word panels open without them overlapping. The writing and pictures are crisp. And the colors vivid.
customer_reviews.author: Ashish Sen

customer_reviews.title: good quality but it is a customer return item, not a brand new !!
customer_reviews.text: 3 stars is only for the quality for the monitor, sharp and crispy image from my Mac Mini... need to buy a mini-port to display port cable to product 2560x1440 resolution, thats no big deal and acceptable~~~~~~~~ The reason i gave out 3 stars is the monitor I paid for and I received is not a brand new monitor !!!!!!! only power cable and VGA cable come in sealed bag, the display port cable and DVI cable comes in with out any packaging !!! Secondly, the monitor screen without any foam sheet or clear plastic to protect and I can see finger prints on the screen !! Overall experience, I paid almost $100 more for a USED monitor !!!
customer_reviews.author: Eighty One Int'l Inc.

customer_reviews.title: I got a lemon
customer_reviews.text: I got a lemon; it died in a few days. It was relatively easy to return. I also found that 27" was more than the space that I need. I bought a Dell high end monitor instead which I like a lot. My suggestion for others would be to go with a 24" for the lower price and have a second screen. Though, I am sure there are some applications where the 30" is valuable.

customer_reviews.title: Great monitor if your computer has a DisplayPort connection.
customer_reviews.text: The image quality on this monitor is great. The anti-glare screen is truly flat, not glossy like nearly all monitors these days. I was really disappointed to return this product. You should be aware that although this monitor has an HDMI connection, it only supports WQHD 2560x1440 resolution using Display Port. Because my computer only has an HDMI connection, the monitor would only display standard HD resolution of 1920x1080. See page 17 of the User Guide that you can download from the ViewSonic website if you have any questions about compatibility.
customer_reviews.author: Chris K Chapman

customer_reviews.title: Dead pixels and white boxes
customer_reviews.text: The first monitor that I ordered had a dead pixel and a small while box in the lower section that could be seen under a dark background. I returned that item and requested a replacement. The new monitor had more dead pixels and the same white box. I returned it as well and Amazon pulled off the product from its Website. It is a shame that ViewSonic doesn't test their products. These obvious defects should have never passed the quality control. 5 stars for Amazon, 0 stars for the monitor.
customer_reviews.author: Lukasz Sz
